item.title: 黄金下跌抵消了美国降息的希望，多伦多证券交易所（TSX）期货走势低迷
item.description: 周四，与加拿大主要股票指数挂钩的期货市场表现平淡，因为金价下跌抵消了投资者对美国 9 月份降息的乐观预期。【原文：Futures linked to Canada's main stock index were muted on Thursday as losses in gold prices countered investor optimism around U.S. rate-cut hopes in September.】

item.title: Peloton 预测 2025 年订购量低于预期
item.description: 周四，Peloton Interactive 预测 2025 年的订户数将低于分析师的预期，预计其健身器材需求疲软，订户数增长乏力，因为持续的通胀抑制了可自由支配的支出。【原文：Peloton Interactive forecast 2025 subscriptions below analysts' estimates on Thursday, anticipating weak demand for its exercise equipment and sluggish subscriber additions as sticky inflation keeps discretionary spending in check.】

item.title: 保险公司 Aegon 因美国死亡率上升损失 4 亿美元
item.description: 荷兰保险公司 Aegon 周四表示，将在 2024 年上半年计提约 4 亿美元的费用，以反映其主要美国市场与死亡相关的保险索赔增加。【原文：Dutch insurer Aegon booked a charge of around $400 million in the first half of 2024 to reflect higher death-related insurance claims in its key U.S. market, it said on Thursday.】

item.title: 2024 年美国新 ETF 的推出速度创历史新高
item.description: 晨星直接公司（Morningstar Direct）的数据显示，2024 年美国市场上新发行的交易所交易基金数量有望再创新高，平均每月将有 50 只交易所交易基金首次亮相。【原文：The number of new exchange-traded funds hitting the U.S. market is on track to set another record in 2024, according to data from Morningstar Direct, with an average of 50 ETFs making their debut monthly.】

item.title: 沃尔玛与汉堡王合作为会员提供折扣优惠
item.description: 沃尔玛周四表示，它已与 Restaurant Brands 旗下的汉堡王公司合作，为其会员客户提供打折餐饮优惠，这家零售巨头希望提高其服务的吸引力，以便更好地与亚马逊的 Prime 展开竞争。【原文：Walmart said on Thursday it has partnered with Restaurant Brands' Burger King to offer discounted meal benefits to its membership customers as the retail giant looks to make its services more attractive to compete better with Amazon's Prime.】

item.title: 谁是 Revolut 的首席执行官 Nik Storonsky？
item.description: Revolut创始人兼首席执行官尼克-斯托伦斯基（Nik Storonsky）在去年公司的夏季酒会上对员工说了一句简单的话：让这家金融科技公司做得更大、更好，并打败银行。【原文：Revolut founder and CEO Nik Storonsky had a simple message for his employees at the company's summer drinks last year: make the financial technology firm bigger, better and beat the banks, a person who was there said.】

item.title: 劳资谈判陷入僵局，CN 铁路公司和 CPKC 关闭加拿大铁路网
item.description: 加拿大国家铁路公司（Canadian National Railway）和加拿大太平洋堪萨斯城公司（Canadian Pacific Kansas City）在与一个主要工会谈判未果后，从周四开始将工人锁在家中。【原文：Canadian National Railway and Canadian Pacific Kansas City have locked out workers, starting Thursday, after unsuccessful negotiations attempts with a major labor union.】

item.title: 凯雷集团将以 15 亿美元收购 Advance Auto Parts 旗下的 Worldpac 部门
item.description: Advance Auto Parts 周四表示，私募股权公司 Carlyle Group 将以 15 亿美元现金收购其 Worldpac 部门，使其股价在盘前交易中上涨约 11%。【原文：Advance Auto Parts said on Thursday private equity firm Carlyle Group would buy its Worldpac unit for $1.5 billion in cash, sending its shares about 11% higher in premarket trade.】

item.title: 道明银行因与美国调查有关的 26 亿美元拨备而转为季度亏损
item.description: 加拿大第二大银行道明银行（TD Bank）周四出现季度亏损，原因是美国监管机构对其反洗钱（AML）项目进行了调查，道明银行为此预留了 35.7 亿加元（26.3 亿美元）的罚款。【原文：TD Bank swung to a quarterly loss on Thursday as the second-largest Canadian lender set aside C$3.57 billion ($2.63 billion) for fines related to U.S. regulatory probes into its anti-money laundering (AML) program.】

item.title: 美联储杰克逊霍尔研讨会看点
item.description: 本周，来自世界各地的央行行长们飞抵怀俄明州杰克逊霍尔，参加堪萨斯城联储在大提顿国家公园举行的年度研讨会，这已成为全球最重要的经济集会。【原文：Central bankers from around the world fly into Jackson Hole, Wyoming, this week to attend what has become the globe's premier economic gathering, the Kansas City Federal Reserve's annual symposium in Grand Teton National Park.】

item.title: 中国平安保险上半年利润增长 6.8
item.description: 中国平安保险（集团）股份有限公司周四发布的文件显示，上半年净利润增长 6.8%。【原文：Ping An Insurance (Group) Co of China reported a 6.8% rise in first-half net profit in a filing released on Thursday.】

item.title: 充分利用混合工作的四个技巧
item.description: 如果你怀疑混合动力工作的价值，就和 L Parker Barnum 聊一聊吧。【原文：If you ever question the value of hybrid work, just have a chat with L Parker Barnum.】

item.title: 美国增资和其他华尔街银行规则现在取决于美国大选
item.description: 五位熟知内情的人士表示，美国监管机构将无法在 11 月总统大选前最终敲定有争议的银行资本上调方案，这让人怀疑这些方案以及其他针对华尔街银行的严格规则草案能否完成。【原文：U.S. regulators will not be able to finalize contentious bank capital hikes before the November presidential election, casting doubt over whether those and other stiff draft rules for Wall Street banks will be completed at all, said five people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Target 的杂货折扣出人意料地促进了服装和美容产品的销售
item.description: 塔吉特的杂货降价终于有了回报。【原文：Target's price cuts on groceries are finally paying off.】

item.title: 巴西电网限制风能和太阳能发电，威胁可再生能源项目
item.description: 巴西的风能和太阳能生产商警告说，由于国家电网运营商在过去一年中一再限制他们的能源输送量，挤压了他们的利润，他们正在重新考虑未来在巴西的投资。【原文：Wind and solar energy producers in Brazil have warned they are reconsidering future investments there after the national grid operator repeatedly capped how much energy they could deliver in the past year, which squeezed their profits.】

item.title: 早间竞价美元之王的王冠正在滑落
item.description: Dhara Ranasinghe 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天。【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets by Dhara Ranasinghe.】

item.title: 消息人士称，德国计划持有游轮制造商多数股权
item.description: 熟悉内情的消息人士周四告诉路透社，作为支持世界顶级游轮制造商之一 Meyer Werft 的措施之一，德国政府计划暂时持有该公司的多数股权。【原文：The German government plans to take a temporary majority stake in Meyer Werft, one of the world's top cruise ship builders, as part of measures to support the company, sources familiar with the matter told Reuters on Thursday.】

item.title: 澳大利亚竞争监管机构将监控国内机票价格
item.description: 澳大利亚竞争监管机构周四表示，在当地航空公司 Regional Express 退出市场后，该机构将密切关注大都市之间的国内航线票价。【原文：Australia's competition regulator said on Thursday that it will closely monitor domestic air fares on services between metropolitan cities, after local carrier Regional Express withdrew from the market.】

item.title: 美国汽车安全监管机构结束对通用汽车 Cruise 机器人轴的调查
item.description: 美国国家公路交通安全管理局（National Highway Traffic Safety Administration）周四表示，将结束对通用汽车公司 Cruise 部门运营的自动驾驶乘车汽车的硬制动和固定装置的初步评估。【原文：The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said on Thursday it was closing its preliminary evaluation into hard braking and immobilization in autonomous ride-hailing vehicles operated by General Motors' Cruise unit.】

item.title: 随着 9 月降息的可能性增大，期货价格走高
item.description: 美国股指期货周四小幅走高，原因是市场对美联储可能在下月启动宽松政策周期保持乐观，目前的焦点已转向决策者本周在杰克逊霍尔发表的评论。【原文：U.S. stock index futures were marginally higher on Thursday, as sentiment remained upbeat about the Federal Reserve possibly kicking off its policy easing cycle next month, with focus now shifting to policymakers' commentary at Jackson Hole this week.】

item.title: 要完成印度合并，迪斯尼-信实可能需要削弱板球的主导地位
item.description: 印度反垄断机构反对华特-迪斯尼公司和信实公司拟以 85 亿美元合并印度媒体资产，这可能会迫使这两家公司出售一些利润丰厚的板球转播权或承诺广告价格上限。【原文：The Indian antitrust body's opposition to a proposed $8.5 billion merger of the Indian media assets of Walt Disney and Reliance may force the companies to sell some lucrative cricket broadcast rights or commit to advertising price caps.】

item.title: 7-Eleven 日本老板考虑竞购，美国粉丝渴望 "conbini "食品
item.description: Seven & i Holdings 通过提供新鲜的三明治、饭团和一排排盒饭，将简陋的 7-Eleven 商店变成了日本的热门美食目的地，改变了数百万人的饮食方式。【原文：Seven & i Holdings turned the humble 7-Eleven store into a popular food destination in Japan by serving up fresh sandwiches, rice balls and rows of boxed lunches, changing how millions of people eat.】

item.title: 中国百度季度营收超预期
item.description: 搜索引擎巨头百度周四公布的季度营收高于市场预期，表明中国广告市场有所复苏。【原文：Search engine giant Baidu , reported quarterly revenue above market estimates on Thursday, signaling some recovery in the Chinese advertising market.】

item.title: 邮政银行结算后德意志银行股价上涨
item.description: 德意志银行周四股价上涨超过 2%，因为这家德国银行与半数以上指控其在 2010 年收购邮政银行时支付过少的原告达成了和解。【原文：Deutsche Bank shares rose more than 2% on Thursday after the German lender's settlements with more than half the plaintiffs who accused it of underpaying them in its takeover of Postbank in 2010.】

item.title: 沃尔沃赢得 DSV 300 辆电动卡车订单
item.description: 瑞典 AB 沃尔沃公司周四表示，已收到丹麦物流公司 DSV 300 辆电动卡车的订单。【原文：Sweden's AB Volvo said on Thursday it had received an order for 300 electric trucks from Danish logistics firm DSV .】

item.title: 采购经理人指数显示：奥运提振欧元区商业活动
item.description: 一项调查显示，尽管企业提高了价格，但欧元区 8 月份的商业活动出人意料地强劲，这可能会削弱人们对欧洲中央银行今年再降息两次的预期。【原文：Euro zone business activity showed surprising strength in August despite firms raising prices, a survey showed, potentially weakening expectations for two more rate cuts from the European Central Bank this year.】

item.title: 德国 8 月份商业活动收缩，PMI 显示
item.description: 周四的一项初步调查显示，德国 8 月份的商业活动连续第二个月出现萎缩，且萎缩幅度超出预期。【原文：German business activity contracted in August for a second consecutive month and by more than expected, a preliminary survey showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普的焦虑刺激了对欧洲防务初创企业的投资
item.description: 据八位业内知名高管和投资者称，唐纳德-特朗普可能重返白宫有助于刺激欧洲各国对国防科技初创企业的投资热潮。【原文：Donald Trump's potential White House return has helped spur a flurry of investment in defence-technology startups across Europe, according to eight prominent industry executives and investors.】

item.title: 孟加拉国央行行长告诉 BBC，孟加拉国将在未来几天内将利率上调至 9%，以抑制通货膨胀
item.description: 孟加拉央行行长在周四早些时候发表的一篇采访中告诉英国广播公司（BBC），孟加拉央行将在未来几天内把利率从 8.5% 提高到 9%，以抑制飙升的通货膨胀。【原文：Bangladesh's central bank will raise interest rates to 9% from 8.5% in the coming days in a bid to tame soaring inflation, the bank's governor told the BBC in an interview published early on Thursday.】

item.title: 外国投资者回流，马来西亚大放异彩，同行则步履蹒跚
item.description: 马来西亚正迅速成为东南亚的避风港，外国投资者正重返这个长期被忽视的市场，因为增长改善、政府稳定和货币升值等因素使其在政治动荡的同行中脱颖而出。【原文：Malaysia is fast becoming a haven in Southeast Asia and foreign investors are returning to a long-overlooked market as a confluence of improving growth, stable government and rising currency sets it apart among peers grappling with political flux.】
